div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1012 Taman' Peninsula, Krasnodar Ter- ritory, RSFSR, 1866-1867 Burial: mid 4th cent. B.C. Contents: AV, EL Panticapaeum: 4 st. (as BMC 1) Cyzicus: 2 st. 3 hecte Disposition: dispersed Goertz, Drevnosti 2 (Moscow, 1870), pp. 236-8 (letters from Liutsenko) = Arkheologiches- kaia topografiia Tamanskogo poluostrova (Moscow, 1870), pp. 45-6 = Sobranie sochinenii I (St. Petersburg, 1898), pp. 54-5 Liutsenko, p. 26 Zograph, "Zolotye monety," 3, 5 Shelov, VDI 1949, no. 2, pp. 96-7 Shelov considers this a hd.; Zograph, a find of separate coins. Liutsenko, in his letter to Goertz, speaks of a find, provenance unknown, of "two gold double Cyzicene staters and three quarter-staters, a few silver coins of Apollonia, three gold staters of Panti- capaeum, etc."
